title: Dot type (not dotmatrix or any matrix sort)
content:
Anything close to this one or similar (above is different from bellow)?  
(i allready found Julian Moreys [Frieze](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&displayfontid=CU.126094.0.0))

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DOTFONT_4515.jpg)
author: cicifoo

comments.content:
This has come up before .. but...

The top looks like a typeface used by Duchamp for » La mariee mise a nu par ses celibataires meme « [Link](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527/http:/www.moma.org/images/collection/FullSizes/00093022.jpg) recently re-brought to life by [Jon Hares](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Designers/Jonathan+Hares/) see also the SCHNITTPUNKT identity by Elektrosmog [http://www.esmog.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527/http:/www.esmog.org/ "http://www.esmog.org")

The bottom is a modified version of the Tate typeface by [Practise](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527/http:/www.practise.co.uk/work/2003/olafur-eliasson.html)

Not, that any of that gets you any closer to an alternative.. Especially if you want one not so modular / "tech-y", and not Moreys Frieze. Sorry.

If you are alternative doesn't have to be sans serif, i kinda like [Intimo Two](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/fontsearch.php?q=intimo&ss=2) by Gareth Hague which is distributed through T-26.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019003527im_/http:/typophile.com/files/initim_4050.png)
Thanks Zachary... that is quite some detailed insight... nice work on your site btw... the t26 one is quite nice actually though i was really looking for a clean sans...
